result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Neumiller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sexual Intercourse with Child 16 or Older, Actor 19 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow early termination after 1 year if the Agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes: Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or durg paraphernalia.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling including sex offender treatment recommended by Agent. 

Full time employment and/or combination of schooling.  

No contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted after defendant turns 23 years old and upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

timeConds.notes: Sentence is to commence 10/31/2022 by 5:00 pm.  Defendant is to serve the FIRST 5 DAYS WITH HUBER.  Standard release conditions.  The remaining balance of the sentence is to be served through Day Report Center

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Sexual Intercourse with Child 16 or Older, Actor 19 or Older
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas J Neumiller

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:30 a.m.
Intern Abigail Kincheloe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Donna Jean Kuchler in court for Nicholas J Neumiller.  
Defendant Nicholas J Neumiller in court. 
Victim A in court by video.
Victim Representative in court by video.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense requests expunction.  State objects.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
6 MONTHS JAIL
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS
Court will allow early termination after 1-year if the Agent deems appropriate.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling including sex offender treatment recommended by Agent
Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling
No contact with: Victim A

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: TOTAL 30-DAYS 
Sentence is to commence on 10-31-2022 by 5:00 p.m.
Defendant is to serve the first 5-days with HUBER (Standard Release Conditions)
The Balance of the sentence is to be served on Day Report Center.

Expunction is conditionally granted after defendant turns 23 years old and upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
